Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma bowled R Ashwin out and used him to bowl the 17th over
David Miller hit successive sixes to bring the required run-rate down to less than a run-a-ball
Karthik off injured and Rishabh Pant kept in his absence
Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 and his 11th half-century of his T20I career
Temba Bavuma failed again and made the right decision to only use Keshav Maharaj for three overs
Wayne Parnell started swinging and beat the outside edge throughout that over
Anrich Nortje sent down fireballs at over 150kph and removed Deepak Hooda for a duck
Kagiso Rabada ran around to take the catch and India were left stunned on 41 for 3
Rohit Sharma opted to bat for no particular reason, other than that it's a good surface
Pre-Game Insights: Temba Bavuma hasn't called correctly so India win the toss
Rohit Sharma has opted to bat for no particular reason, other than that it's a good surface
India have got an excellent pack of their own so we should be in for a real treat
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's win means that not only do Pakistan have to beat South Africa on Thursday but also hope either India lose to Bangladesh and Zimbabwe or South Africa are defeated by the Netherlands

Temba Bavuma failed again and made the right decision to only use Keshav Maharaj for three overs

Miscellaneous Highlights: The conditions in this match were enjoyable
South Africa's fast men were exceptional and used the short ball to excellent effect
India's attack were also outstanding for the most part
Aiden Markram and David Miller changed gears and slammed 76 runs in 10 overs
South Africa set the tone in the field
The result has big implications for the rest of the group, particularly Pakistan
Others: India were 49 for 5 in the ninth over and relied on Suryakumar Yadav to carry them
SKY became the highest run-scorer in T20I cricket in 2022, going past Mohammad Rizwan
Rohit Sharma is also human and had three stumps to aim at when Markram set off a single that should never have been run and missed
